description:
In a world that is only visible with the aid of a microscope, life is teeming with activity and tension. Germs are in a constant state of growth and propagation. In the petri dish, only one faction of germs can reign supreme. It is an epic war of microscopic proportions. Each faction will vie for control of the petri dish, one section at a time. Through sheer dominance, the strongest germ faction will win out. The fate of the petri dish begins with the roll of the dice.

In Germ War, two players will attempt to grow and propagate their germ factions, in order to conquer the petri dish. The faction that dominates a majority of the sections, reign supreme and wins!

At the beginning of each round, a player will mark off the next available spot on the round tracker. Alternating turns, players can do one of two actions: "Germ Growth or "Germ Strength Increased". When a player chooses Germ Growth, they will draft a reproduction die and apply the effects. If a player has a section(s) with a die valued at six, that player will increase their Germ Strength by marking off their germ icon and rotate the die to a one. The first player to do this three times in a section, will maintain a dominate presence in that section for the remainder of the section. If a player does this four times in the game, that player wins the game.

—description from the designer

Nujum is a relaxed-paced, abstract board game for 2 players about predicting the movement of the stars.

In a turn of Nujum, players each play one card from their hand face-down to move the Star Token on the central board according to their card's value. The catch: In your turn, your opponent's card gets resolved first. If you can't move the token to the full number of spaces indicated on your card, it's discarded - not scoring you any points.

Should the stars not align for you at any point, don't worry! Eclipse Cards allow you to alter the movement of the Star Token, changing cards' suits, replacing them with cards from your hand or scoring your card without moving the Star Token altogether.

Nujum, the Arabic word for "Stars", draws inspiration from the Islamic Golden Age when scholars with diverse backgrounds used to discuss Astrology, Astronomy and Philosophy on an equal footing.

—description from the designer

Embark on a wild undersea adventure with this fast-paced tile placement/puzzle game. Use clever strategies to place your tiles correctly in a colourful and growing seascape of creatures that includes the Yellow Submarine Slug and Jellyfish. Be the first to play all your tiles to win the game.

Throw Octopus! Play a tile with a special octopus icon and you'll earn an Action card that can help or hurt you. A 'Throw Octopus' card allows you to throw the Octopus Plushie at your opponent then they have to draw 2 tiles and lose their next turn!

Time of Wars is a multiplayer card driven game. Players are on the head of five superpowers in Eastern Europe – the Polish – Lithuanian Commonwealth, the Tsardom of Russia, the Ottoman Empire, the Kingdom of Sweden and the Holy Roman Empire. Minor states are also present – Denmark, Brandenburg, Moldova, Wallachia, Transylvania and Crimean Khanate.

The game covers the turn of XVI and XVII centuries. The period was rich in famous characters (rulers and commanders) and critical events – for example the Time of Troubles in the Tsardom, the Thirty Years War in the Reich, Swedish “Deluge” in the Commonwealth. All these and much more are smoothly incorporated during gameplay.

The heart of the game are five decks of cards – one for each superpower.

During gameplay there is a lot of interaction between players. They can declare wars or make alliances as effect of secret negotiations.

Won battles and wars are important, but players must take care about condition of their own states as well. In the game are shown factors like economy, domestic policy, military level and religion. All of them can affect specified players’ actions.

The game has a lot of options for each player and each state has its own problems and advantages. Despite this the gameplay is extremely well balanced. 
There are 5 scenarios. The main scenario is for 5 players. Four shorter scenarios are for 2 or 3 players.

Call the Spirits is a 100 card Commander preconstructed deck, featured in Commander 2015 . It is bicolor white/black. The primary theme of the deck is enchantments, and the secondary theme is lifegain. The primary new commander is Daxos the Returned, the secondary new commander is Karlov of the Ghost Council, and the reprint commander is Teysa, Envoy of Ghosts.

Daxos the Returned travels across Theros in a never-ending search surrounded by spirits that are drawn to his power. As mighty enchantments enter the battlefield, the spirits he summons grow larger, leaving his enemies overwhelmed.

Interstellar Nomad is a set collection game where players earn points for completing the planet panoramas. In your quest for interstellar inhabitance, you’ll compete with an opponent to earn the highest Nomad Score. to win each round and the overall game.

DESCRIPTION Construct panorama’s of planets across the galaxy through twists and turns, outwit your opponent in this compact easy-to-learn, two-player card game!

HOW TO PLAY

Greetings, Interstellar Nomad. Interstellar Nomad is a set collection game where players earn points for completing the planet panoramas. In your quest for interstellar inhabitance, you’ll compete with an opponent to earn the highest Nomad Score. to win each round and the overall game.

A game of Interstellar Nomad is played over 2 or more rounds. Each round consists of 4 steps:

Setup
Shuffle all cards into a deck. Deal 2 cards to you and your opponent. Place the remaining cards in a face-down draw pile on the table. Draw 5 cards and place them face-down in a Universal Row next to the deck with each card alternating orientation. Once the Universal Row is in place, reveal all face-down cards. Randomly determine the starting player for the first round. The losing player starts subsequent rounds.

Play Cards
Players take turns placing a single card onto their own play area. Cards can be played in one of two ways:

Place a card from your hand into your play area face up and in any orientation. This card will either start or continue a set. [next Resolve Card Actions]

Select a face-up card (active card) from the Universal Row and place it in your play area to start or continue a set. The card may be placed in the correct order of the set but must maintain it's previous orientation — landscape or portrait. [next Resolve Card Actions]

Resolve Card Actions
After playing a card, the player must execute the played card’s action(s), selecting and affecting a different active card — the active card must be within their play area or the Universal Row. [see Card Actions] The player then draws a card and adds it to the end of the Universal Row following alternating orientation. Play continues until all possible cards are played.

Determine the Winner
Points are awarded as follows at the end of each round: +1 for each active card within a set -1 for each missing card in a set -1 for each inactive card -1 for possessing the Wasteland (-2 if inactive) Bonus points are awarded for each complete set: +1 for a complete set in the correct order +1 for a complete set in the correct orientation The player with the highest Nomad Score after all cards are played wins the round.

The first player to win 2 rounds is the winner of the game and continues their interstellar journey.

Get ready for a merchant’s adventure ! Go on the roads of Karanor and become a wandering merchant in search for wealth and glory !

In Merchants of Karanor, you will try to reach 10 notoriety points before your oppponents by opening new commerces, achieving quests for the locals or even buying a private villa.

During your turn, you will perform 4 actions among 6 permitted : travel, collect resources, interact with a local, open a commerce, work or realize a special action. At the end of your turn, players will receive the income of their commerce and the production of their associates.

During your travels, you will be able to gathers rewards and advantages, recruit associates, buy some illegal services to the black market or find a rare artifact to improve your character or your business activities, in order to move faster to victory.

Interactions between players are an important part of the game. Everything in the game can be traded, sold or bartered between players. Black market cards will allow you to slow your opponents  in their quest for glory and bring tensions to the negotiations !

—description from publisher

It's the ultimate undersea faceoff battle of speed, wit and dexterity. In this fast-paced tile placement game, you'll race against your opponent to score points as you build colourful sea creatures. You must be quick as you battle your opponent for new tiles from a shared tile pile. It's octopus Duel!

Small sea creatures (4 tiles) are worth 1 point, large sea creatures (6+ tiles) are worth 2 points at the end of the game the player with the most points wins!

In Politi-King, players are trying to get to 30 coins or kill all their opponents around the table. However, players can accept bribes, so whoever can make the best deals is sure to win!

Each player begins with 25 health and 3 coins. At the end of each one of their turns, a player draws a card. Cards have a value of 3-7 and be either coins or swords. Coin cards are immediately replaced with coin tokens. However, sword cards can be used on future turns to lower someone else's health by the indicated amount, which usually leads to lots of threats and deals.

All deals are binding on the turn they occur, but you don't have to follow up threats. Will you be able to get away with paying nothing? Will you become a coward, but also a survivor? Will you establish Communism? Will you give away your money to appear weak, only to watch a bloodbath ensue between everyone else? Nearly anything can happen in Politi-King.

-description from designer

Happy Bee is the fourth game in Helvetiq's "Fun by Nature" eco-friendly collection.

Each round, all players select their bee card(s) at the same time, then place them face down on the table in front of them. (The number of cards chosen varies with the round.) Once the cards are revealed, players check the majority for each family and collect flower cards, which are worth points.

When all the flower cards are distributed or discarded, pass the non-selected bee cards (which are still face down) to your left neighbor. Take the bee cards from your right neighbor and add the bee cards you just selected for this round to your hand. You should have seven bee cards again and can now play a new round.

The game ends after the ninth round. You add all the points of the flower cards you collected during the game, and whoever has the most points wins.

—description from publisher

PatagoSaurios is the fifth author's game from the Ludogonia publishing house. In this simple and quick game you will have to reveal your Find cards. If you see that the necessary Finds appeared, Flip over the Dinosaur card!

The cards will be played in rounds, and whoever has the best score will win. But be careful, if you incorrectly cover a card, you get penalty tokens! Which subtract your final score.

PatagoSaurios was worked in conjunction with the Paleovertebrate Laboratory of the National University of Patagonia San Juan Bosco, for which it has an educational brochure on the different species that appear throughout the game.

A tile-matching, stack-building game in which 2-4 players race to empty their hands of pentagonal tiles.  Tiles are matched by either 1 of the 5 colors or by 1 of the 5 symbols, and should a stack reach 5 colors, the stack splits in 2, increasing the odds of playable tiles on future turns. At the end of each round, once 1 player has stacked their last tile, each other player scores 1 point for each tile left in their hand. Rounds continue until one player has a score of at least 12, at which point the player with the lowest cumulative score wins.

Frontera was once a peaceful kingdom that dwell
many races from centaur that roams in forest, cyclops that dominate the mountain, and dwarf that live in dune. After the king is died of illness the kingdom is torn and fought over by 2 legitimate princes.

Each player represent the prince that try to win
this war by drafting dan deploying its army. Frontera is a 2 players game with 1 solo module for solo player, in this game each player will try to captured most token and controlling most terrain while balancing with owned resources

For more replayability, a player may choose from 3 alternative setup of modular terrain tile. With each setup a new style to attacking and defending yourself is made.

The core of this game is about placing your tokens using mancala mechanic and march them to chain battle combos while capturing enemies and controlling as many terrain as possible.

In the solo mode your objective is different than the 2 player game, because this time you will try to conquer the enemy as soon as possible before running out tokens.

Embark on an adventure and fight for survival in an area full of wild saurians. You are sent on your way with a few simple items. Everything else you have to scavenge for, fight for or craft yourself. Use the strength and skills of the saurians by adding them to your squad with a catching utensil. Collect everything you need on the plain, in the cave and on the lake to face the ultimate challenge in the jungle: the T-Rex!

You start with a deck consisting of 9 base cards and move along the hexagonal game board. During the game you will visit different locations and expand your deck with cards from a selection of 165 uniquely designed objects and saurians. With your cards you can move, attack, defend yourself, craft, trade and use card effects. As the game goes on you prepare yourself to defeat the T-Rex before the other player/team does. This wins you the game. The T-Rex is regularly moving withing the jungle, so you have to plan how to get to it safely with enough attack power in hand to best it. There are five different T-Rex variants which determine the game's difficulty/duration.

Saurvival is a mix of board and card game. Prepare for a strategic adventure full of action, fun and dinosaurs.

Warcrow Adventures is a fantasy co-op dungeon crawler. Throughout the match, you'll become the protagonist of a unique tactical and narrative story. Join your teammates and venture into Hawthorn Point to try and overcome its challenges.

This game combines tactical, action playing with a deep focus on the narrative. Through the game, you will interact with other characters, learn their stories, talk to NPCs, explore different scenarios, fight a range of different enemies, and thrive in the development of the story.

In Warcrow Adventures, you control a character who has come to Hawthorn Point in search of artifacts from the ancient elven empire of Gae Assail. The game follows a campaign game format in which each match corresponds to an episode in the story. During each scenario, you will make decisions, investigate the evil that lurks hidden in the Fog and must fight it to survive.

—description from the publisher

“They saw The Dreki of Odin and the other Gods in the grey sky. They came to save the beloved Mannheimr from the bloody invasion of the Jotunn. The Gods came down from the sacred ship, gliding on their shields, surrounded by flaming embers. I spent my whole life looking for the place where they landed and where the battle took place, I’m finally sure I found it!” The sound of the horns cuts off the old Alfarinn. The Drekar from each clan depart the Roskilde harbor, bringing on board the most valiant and skillful heroes. The hunt for the mysterious Runic Gems, fragments of divine power, has just begun!

Runar is a competitive board game with high interaction and comic-style miniatures. Each player forms and guides a Warband of three Viking Heroes through frozen and harsh lands, teeming with savage and lethal creatures.

Earn victory points by defeating powerful Enemies, retrieving valuable Runic Gems, completing various objectives, and defeating opposing Heroes. Destiny Cards mark the unique moments of the game and trigger the final round. The Warband of Heroes with the most victory points wins the game and grants access to Ragnarok!

Play epic single matches, with Heroes at full power, or play a 5 episodes campaign, evolving your Heroes during the journey.

—description from the publisher

The Rebel Girls range is an empowering collection for both young girls and boys, showcasing the history and achievements of women of the past and present. We are proud to be a part of this important mission to inspire and instil confidence in our children.

In Card Game for Rebel Girls, the aim of the of the game is to collect and complete sets of Character Cards to score as many Rebel Reward points as possible. Each Rebel Reward Card requires a different team of Rebel Girls to complete the task, so players must use their Character Cards’ strengths and Wild Cards to build a squad of strong girls.

There are five categories of Rebel Girls in the game: Champions, Warriors, Leaders, Pioneers and Creators. Characters such as Harriet Tubman, the Bronte sisters, Eva Peron, Hypatia, Boudicca, Katia Krafft, Wilma Rudolph and Junk Tabei are all included. The game allows players to learn a little more about each Rebel Girl and what their achievements have been throughout history. Each card describes the characters and explains what made them special and unique.

This empowering card game is ideal for children aged six plus, and includes personalised certificates for anyone who is inspired to achieve greatness in their own lives. Whilst learning about incredible women throughout history, the Card Game for Rebel Girls also encourages players to be bold, work hard and be proud.

Chak is a Chess and Xiangqi style game designed by Couch Tomato in 2021 specifically to answer the hypothetical question of what a chess variant developed by mesoamerican cultures would look like. The design philosophy was to start from scratch and use only the common elements from all forms of chess: a king, a rook-type piece, a knight-like piece, and some sort of pawns; the rest would develop organically infusing a specific Mesoamerican culture -- in this case, the Maya.

The various pieces move and capture in different ways by replacing the captured piece, as in chess, and victory is achieved by checkmating or stalemating the opposing king. An alternate win condition called "altar mate" is achieved by moving the king into the opponent's space on the board called the "temple."

As the young captain of the Obsidian, a mercenary troop that offers its military talents, your responsibility is immense: you must take the best decisions for yourself and your troops.
Employed by the King of Hauora, earn the respect of your three corps, analyze the battlefields to adopt the right strategies, listen to the advice of your lieutenants, and mount your horse. Make the right choices, because you are the hero!

L'Obsidienne is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher

2048: The robots have taken over and the few human survivors are trying to hide.
You play as Carl, designated to search for a cure for the deadly epidemic that threatens.
Manage your food, limit your combat wounds, scan the environment for equipment, medicine and plants. Will you be captured by the surveillance drones? Shot down by the robots?
Make wise choices to save your community, because you are the hero!

Zone 25 is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher

Dark crimes, perpetrated by The Black Blade, have thrown London into terror. Scotland Yard has failed to find the murderer, but you can help identify him.

Play as Detective Holmes or Dr. Watson, tracking down clues, interviewing witnesses and using your deductive skills. Make the right choices to solve these three investigations, because you are the hero!

Sherlock Holmes: Darkness over London is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

-description from the publisher's website

Lockdown is a semi-cooperative game that takes you into a horrific world overwhelmed by Monsters which you know nothing about … besides their veracious appetite for your skinny little human bodies. Semi-cooperative means that you win alone, but you will have to help others to get there. You will create temporary alliances, you will lie, betray for the sole purpose of making sure that your family survives.
Each round represents a day through which you will vote to know :

     Who has access to the stock of merchandises in the truck in the parking lot ?
     Who will be in charge of the security cameras and can say where the Monsters are coming ? 
     Who will die during each attack of the Monsters ?


Each second, its dilemma. 
To trust, or not to trust, unite or betray.
Only the survival of your family matters.

—description from the publisher

The Battle of Aqbat al-Bakr is a small and simple postcard game published as a freebie by SNAFU Design, as a gift for attendees to the Pax Ludica 2022 Wargaming convention (Cadis, Spain). It's the fourth of the Snafu Postcard Games.

It's a 2-player game depicting a small battle during the civil war in the Caliphate of Cordoba in 1010 AD. Some Christian Catalan counts joined forces with one of the Muslim candidates (Muhammad al-Mahdi) and fought against the other candidate to the caliphate, Sulaiman al-Mustain, backed by berber (imazighen) troops.

On his turn the player rolls two dice and the results are the number of Movement Points (one die) and the number of Combat Points (the other die). Then the player assigns these points among his units as he sees fit to move, rally, fight, charge (heavy units) and/or harass (light units). The first one to disorganize or kill all enemy units wins.

—description from the designer

Recreate the atmosphere of a escape room at home! You have 60 minutes to find the clues hidden by the Game Master that will allow you to solve all the puzzles. The game offers three scenarios, all different, to test the strongest nerves.

A trick-taking tarot card game that mixes the tradition of a historical deck and the innovation of a Bridge-inspired bidding system.

Bid the perfect contract with your partner and play your cards to win points and tricks.

Be aware of the special properties of cards like the Bagatto, the Fool and the World.

A deep but fast-paced card game.

—description from the designer

It's the Age of Sail and the Crown is distilling rum on colonized islands for enormous profit. Meanwhile pirates intend to sail in, steal that rum, and drink it all . These two factions (*Crown* and *Pirate*) play their conflict out over a two player asymmetric card game. Each player has a deck, a hand of cards, coins, and a menu of 3 actions to choose from each turn. But what each does varies substantially.

The *Crown* player will work in secret, laying traps and pushing for an economic victory. They score rum by founding it on an island and investing coins into it over time. They protect that investment by placing hazards in front of the island face-down. When the Pirate player tries to raid that island the Crown can decide to spend their coin to raise those hazards against the Pirate, stopping them or making them pay a terrible price. The Crown may alternatively place traps or economic investments on their islands, luring the Pirate to certain doom or increasing the momentum of the Crown's victory. If the Crown manages to hold out and score four points of rum, they win the game.

The *Pirate* player will assemble ships and crew. These will hopefully raid their way to where the rum is with a combination of deduction and perseverance. But regardless they will trigger and combo together unique crew's unique abilities to gain an advantage. If the Pirate finds four bottles of rum (quality doesn't matter), they win the game.

—description from designer

Mana Mana is a card-set collection game in which it is wise to share your wisdom to always remain the wiser.

Everything revolves around mana, the Maori life force. To increase it, all players try to match pictures of the same symbols. Those who form color rows of up to six cards are rewarded with precious mana stones — but if you keep an eye only on your own cards, you won't get very far. You can add only cards of other suits that have already been played! And so those who help their fellow players in a particularly lucrative way do themselves good.

Whoever is "selflessly" showered with mana and rows of cards in the course of the game has done the most for their fellow players...and wins.

—description from the publisher

Piazza Rabazza is a game in which shaking walls steal pizzas.

As a pizza delivery boy in Rabazza, you really have your hands full. The whole town is craving pizza! Luigi sweeps into all corners of the city on his motor scooter, and his fast-paced delivery tour becomes even more turbulent because all the walls shake when pizza maker Pino kneads his dough. Then not only do the walls get close to Luigi; some residents also impatiently snatch other customers' pizzas off the plate.

Whoever manages to deliver to all of their customers first, cleverly dodging snapping pizza thieves and shaking walls, wins!

—description from the publisher

Animericals is a devious dice & card matching game. Players take turns drawing cards to match randomly rolled dice.

But these dice are like no other. Instead of the abstract shapes we all know as numbers, colorful animals represent 0-9. Instead of the number one, a unicorn horn reminds us that all mythical creatures in the game match '1'.

Use mechanics like, color stacking to build strategies and replace all the dice using super combos.

Whoever can recite the the full hidden sequence (without interruption) wins the game.

—description from the designer

Turn and tilt the dice in the way that suits you best... The tactical dice game for people with bad luck!

Everyone has their own playing sheet on which they cross off their results. Together you tilt and push the dice over the game board and try to be the first to reach 3 Drebos. Every time you turn the dice, and perhaps use a special ability first, you can cross off a square on your block that corresponds to the colour and number of the dice square. There are row and colour combos. To do this, you must either have 5 crosses in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row, or have 5 crossed squares of the same colour. You must announce each DREBO aloud and cross it off on your game board. It is common to show more enthusiasm with each additional DREBO, to shout louder and even to jump up at the end!

DREBO is an entertaining dice game for the whole family. With 8 different playing sheets and 2 game boards, it can be combined again and again. Due to high interactivity, there is no waiting time during the moves of the others.

ZAG is a visual game about solving graphic puzzles in zig-zag.

Each player has a mini-board, five double-sided tiles and a deck of cards showing visual challenging patterns to solve as fast as one can.

Each card shows a number of tiles to be placed and solve its pattern, from only two to five tiles. But don´t be fooled. Sometimes, a two piece puzzle may be surprisingly challenging.
 The deck comes with tutorial cards that help players learn the tile placing rules and practice a little bit before diving into the real ZAG. First: be careful, the board has a specific orientation. Second: tiles are always placed on the board inside its limits. Third: tiles are always placed parallel to the board´s sides, so they are never placed diagonally. And fourth, tiles never overlap!

The game comes with two decks of puzzles: a beginner´s set of 12 cards with hints that show a thumbnail of each tile used to solve that puzzle. Once those cards become too easy, and one might look for a more challenging experience, there is a set of 45 cards showing only the puzzle, without any hint whatsoever.

A game of ZAG is played in rounds. 
Each round, give each player a card and they have to solve it simultaneously.
When someone has finished, flip the card face down and say: - ZAG!
Wait until everyone finishes, check if the puzzles were correctly solved and earn the card as points.
After a round for each count of tiles, from 2 to 5, the game is over.

—description from designer

Each round in Fun Facts, a question is placed in the center of the table, e.g., "How long is the perfect nap?", then everyone secretly writes their answer on their colored arrow and places that arrow face down on the table. (You write your name on the other side of the arrow so that everyone knows which arrow is whose.)

Once everyone has written their answer, take turns placing your arrow in relation to the other players from low to high: "I know that Mom is super sleepy, so I should definitely place my arrow below hers." After everyone has placed their answer in the center of the table, the starting player has the opportunity to move their own arrow — without touching anyone else's!

Then you reveal everyone's numbers, and removes each arrow that is out of order. Each remaining arrow represents a correct answer and provides one point for the entire team. After eight rounds, record the team's score in the Record of Legends. Can you possibly achieve a perfect score?

In the Burg Theater in Vienna 1788, secret information is passed on unnoticed, and players of echoes: Die Violine will need to decode a secret code in order to be able to solve the case.

echoes is a co-operative audio mystery game. Using the free app, players listen to mysterious noises and voices that are connected to the playing material. Together they look for hints in the sound bites to bring the story parts in order and solve the case.

In more detail, your task is to assemble the 24 parts of the story in the right order; each part is represented by an object — either a game board or a card — and its associated echo. The entire story is divided into six chapters, with each chapter being represented by a game board. By scanning the objects with the app, you'll hear the echo connected with each object, and by using conversations and noises in the echo, you try to figure out which three object cards are associated with a chapter and in which order they should be placed. If you're not correct, the app will inform you which cards are incorrect or in the wrong place; if you are correct, you can listen to the entire chapter all at once — and you should since new, additional hints can then be heard.

The objects themselves also provide you with clues from time to time, so neglect no details.

The goal of Catch That Mouse is simple: be the first to lose all your cards. But to do that, you'll have to be fast and sharp-eyed.

You take turns flipping a card and putting it on the central pile. As soon as a Mouse card appears after a Cheese card, you will all try to catch the mouse. The player to last slap, takes the pile.

An easy to learn, yet very entertaining game. The presence of decoys (objects that look just like cheeses and animals that look like mice) makes it easy to make mistakes.

—description from publisher

Heropolis is a humorous yet strategic building & adventure game, in which 2-4 players take on the role of heroes and win the favor of the citizens with their heroic deeds. The ultimate immersive board game, full of surprises. Playing time approx. 40-90 min.!

Slip into the skin of a funny Heropolian and find out if you too are a little everyday hero. 
Provide your fellow citizens with an new metropolis, discover long-abandoned neighborhoods and fill the "News" with your headlines! Together, you protect the townspeople from "Rocktopus" and "Crocodealer" or make off with the latest "high wheels"!
You will be rewarded with stars for your good deeds. Whoever collects the most stars at the end of the session becomes the "Hero of the Day" and wins the game!

Victory or defeat are decided through victory points.
You come to the victory points through various game actions like: Constructing buildings, fighting enemies, soloing Missions, photographing landmarks, etc.

Due to the "Rondel-Mechanic", Heropolis can be strategically planned, but can also easily get beginners into the game. These simply choose one of the three possible actions, while the strategists are planning their actions far into the future.

—description from the publisher

In this beautifully illustrated roll and write, you'll take on the role of a young woman going on a once-in-a-lifetime journey around the world. Travel to incredible landmarks all over the globe - from the Pyramid of Giza to the Matterhorn. Follow the young artist’s journey through her postcards, sent back home to her family to recount the details of her trip.

Try to be the first player to fill in enough boxes to make it to the top of the landmark in this roll-and-write.

All players will pull from the same pool of numbers rolled on the active dice, using the values to make their way up from the bottom to the top of each landmark. Numbers must increase as you climb, so combine the values carefully!

Each location card will bring a series of unique rules, mixing up play and adding to the challenge! At the end of each round, use the action die to change the dice pool and continue your race to the top!

Featuring many of the classic Roll to the Top landmarks, this new edition provides new-and-improved game mechanics plus all-new illustrations by artist Horia Tundrea.

You’re at the end of your 3rd year studying garden design at a prestigious college and are starting to get a little frustrated. Yes, you’re having the time of your life and loving all your classes, but nobody is taking you seriously. You keep telling your parents that there is a career for you and you won’t become a starving artist. When you find out that your local botanic garden is holding an open competition for a succulent wall installation, you’re ecstatic. Finally, a way to prove your legitimacy! However, your professor knows the board and cautions you to submit two designs. Since succulents are trendy, the board will not choose the design that is the most popular, but the one that will be the least controversial. Can you make the best arrangement while navigating the shifting tide of public opinion and secure your first installation?

In this game, you and your opponent will select cards from a display to place in one of your two succulent walls. Cards must follow three simple rules when being placed

     In each column, each card must have a higher number than the card above it.
     In each row, each card must have a color further to the right in the ROYBGV coloring order.
     No orthogonally adjacent cards may share the same number or color.


At the end of each round, you and your opponent will place one card to increase or decrease the point values of each type of succulent. At the end of the game, only your lowest scoring wall will count, so be careful in your choices!

—description from designer

Space Bumpercraft is a game designed based on the Grid Movement mechanism. However, your opponents are not everyone else, but all your own Bumpercraft on the map.

Bumpercrafts all have limited movement patterns, and within the limited options, collisions are inevitable.

How you move your Bumpercrafts and clear the path before the movement for the clunky big Bumpercrafts is the key to victory.

Compare the points with your opponents and see who has the most valued Bumpercrafts surviving.

—description from publisher

WWII Commander, Volume Two: Market-Garden is the second in a series of fast two-player area-based games on key campaigns of the Second World War. The simple elegance and constant player interaction of the WWII Commander games capture the tension of WWII strategy. The game system is a fast-playing introduction to war games, but mastering its tactics is a true challenge as the players take turns deciding which units to activate and where to attack and defend.

Market-Garden recreates the Allied airborne and ground offensive against the German Army in Holland in September 1944. Allied airborne divisions dropped behind German lines to hold a highway corridor across rivers and canals until ground forces could link up to cross into the industrial heart of Germany. Each player commands the opposing Allied or German forces.

The simple elegance and constant player interaction of the WWII Commander games capture the tension of WWII strategy. The game system is a fast-playing introduction to war games, but mastering its tactics is a true challenge as the players take turns deciding which units to activate and where to attack and defend.

As the Allied player, your airborne forces must seize and hold key objectives while your armored ground forces break though the German front and advance aggressively without getting cut off by German infantry and armor coming from all sides. As the German player, you must delay the Allied ground advance, trading space for time as you attempt to destroy the airborne forces behind your lines. The rules are simple, gameplay is fast and furious, and can be completed in one sitting, and either side can win at different stages of the game.

Game features specific to Market-Garden include: Airborne landings, variable weather, concentric attacks, German off-map movement, effects of polder terrain, river assaults, ferry movement.

Product Information:

Complexity: 4 out of 10 (Low)
    Solitaire Suitability: 7 out of 10 (no hidden units)
    Time scale: Half day per game-turn
    Map scale: 5 km across per space
    Unit scale: Regiments and brigades
    Players: Two (also suitable for solitaire play)
    Playing Time: 2 to 4 hours

—description from the publisher

Diatoms is a puzzly tile-placement and pattern-making game in which players create their own microscopic mosaic, based on an obscure Victorian art form.

Hidden in the water all around us are tiny lifeforms known as "diatoms". These microscopic algae cells come in a variety of exquisite geometric shapes and patterns. Their outer layer is made with silica, giving them a glass-like quality. Here at the Society for the Microscopic Arts, we collect these diatoms and delicately arrange them on slides into beautiful, tiny mosaics. As part of your induction into the Society, you will each create your own entry for today's Exhibition of Microscopic Mosaics.

In Diatoms, you compete with your fellow players to collect and place diatom shapes into a mosaic form. You take turns placing tiles representing algae colonies. From that placement, you earn diatoms of different colors and shapes. You then strategically place these diatoms on your personal board, taking care to consider how your arrangement will be scored at the end of the game. In the base scoring, you'll want to achieve matching colors, shape variety, and symmetry along your mosaic's central lines. Each time you play, you may also have a "guest" judge card that brings a unique scoring criterion to the game.

Diatoms also includes a solo variant in which you collect diatom tiles as in the main game, while trying to create a mosaic that fulfills specific requirements from mosaic commission prompts.

—description from publisher

Gift ved første blik ("Married at First Sight") is a reality tv show of Danish origin.
This game casts two players as newlyweds, and the other players are friendly advisors who draw cards with marital dilemmas. Each advisor gets to vote yes or no to each dilemma, and then the newlyweds has to agree on whether to say yes or no to the dilemma.

After four dilemmas, the cards are flipped, and the consequences on four parameters are tallied up: communication, sex life, social life, and economy. If any parameter goes too far out of balance, the marriage fails and the game ends. Otherwise, play goes on to next round, again of four dilemmas. The game ends at latest after three rounds.

Points:
The newlyweds get 1 point for each dilemma they say 'yes' to, and 1 point for 'surviving' the first round, 2 points for the second round, and 3 points for the third round.
The advisors each get a point for each time the newlyweds follow their advice.
However, should the game end because the marriage fails, the advisors who gave the advice that was the final straw of the marriage, each lose 2 points.

—user summary

Mission Complete is a unique cooperative card game of ever changing communication rules. Play the right cards at the right time & use each opportunity to communicate your common mission to win the game.

All players are working together in order to complete 3 missions before the deck of cards runs out.

Each round players are playing a single card that will change their communication restrictions for the following round.

If players manage to play all cards of different colors, they gain 1 part of their mission - a Target or a Task.

Once both the Target & the Task is known, the correct player has to complete it. That is why communication is key to success.

Use every possibility to communicate and plan your turns ahead, because each player will only be able to talk 3 times at most during the game. And a mission can’t be completed without being able to talk!

Everyone loses together if the deck of cards runs out -OR- everyone wins by completing 3 missions first!

—description from publisher

Good staff is hard to find, especially at a Monster Inn. As dungeon masters, you’ll need to look around the local tavern for battle-hardened monsters for your dark dungeon. But the other dungeon masters in your neighbourhood had the same idea, kicking off a fierce bidding competition for the best monsters! If you're not careful, not only will you get the weakest monsters, but you’ll also get one of the nasty humans lurking around the tavern.

In Monster Inn, creature cards of varying value with monsters and humans are revealed in each round. Players want to hire the most powerful monsters and send the nasty little humans to their competitors. Each round players will bid on the cards with gold coins or gems. But the humans are always auctioned off first, and those who can’t or don’t want to bid any longer take the current pool of treasures and the card that is currently being bid on. Who will be the cleverest and fill their own dungeon with powerful monsters that will defeat the humanoid intruders?

—description from publisher

Combo Fighter is a card-driven tribute to the classic arcade fighting games.

Take on the roles of iconic fighters and string together cards to unleash powerful combos.

But be careful. Your deck is also your life bar. Every move you make and every hit you take drains your energy.

To become a true Combo Fighter champion you must make every hit count.

—description from publisher

Answer off-the-wall dilemmas while your besties try to guess your responses.
Left Right Dilemma is a cooperative party game for adults that will reveal your friends’ unspoken (and sometimes shameful) preferences.

How to play?

     Read the card at the summit and choose one of the two options.
     Continue to the card under your choice and answer a new dilemma.
     End your descent in a cabin.
     Do your friends know you well enough to figure out which cabin you reached?

Orda is an asymmetric chess variant that pits the Mongol horde against the kingdom.

The Mongol horde is based around knight movement, with pieces like the horse archer that move like a knight but capture like a bishop, or the Kheshig which moves and captures like a knight and king combined, while the kingdom has the same pieces and opening set up as the standard chess army.

With your combined efforts, you were able to locate the three most powerful artifacts of the wizarding world in your school! However, your joy comes to an abrupt end when you realize that the dark wizards have already entered the school grounds. Will you manage in time to find a suitable hiding place for the artifacts and seal them up forever?

Welcome to Zondance Academy. Here they will learn all the necessary movements for the correct mastery of Zonda Control. Let's not waste any more time, put on your tights and don't forget to warm up each muscle well... let's dance!

Goal
To be the best master of Zonda Control you must be very attentive and follow all the steps indicated by the instructor. When one or more players make a mistake, they will add an error. When a player accumulates 5 errors, the game ends and whoever has the least errors will be the winners.

Preparation
The deck, consisting of 18 cards, is shuffled and placed face down on the table. All players must stand around it.

How to play
On his turn, the active player must draw a card from the deck and place it in the center of the table face up, so that all players can see it. If there are more cards on the table, the new card must cover them so that only the last revealed card is visible. Then you must carry out all the STEPS that have come out so far in the correct order, or, in the event that an evaluation letter has come out, follow its instructions.


Bienvenidos a la academia Zondance. Aquí aprenderán todos los movimientos necesarios para el correcto dominio del Zonda Control. No perdamos más tiempo, pónganse las mallas y no olviden calentar bien cada musculo… ¡a bailar!

Objetivo
Para ser el mejor maestro de Zonda Control debes estar muy atento y seguir todos los pasos que indica el instructor. Cuando uno o varios jugadores se equivoquen sumaran un error. Cuando un jugador acumule 5 errores la partida finaliza y quien o quienes tengan menos errores serán los ganadores.

Preparación
Se mezcla el mazo, compuesto por 18 cartas y se coloca sobre la mesa boca abajo. Todos los jugadores deben estar de pie alrededor de este.

Cómo jugar
En su turno el jugador activo debe sacar una carta del mazo y colocarla en el centro de la mesa boca arriba, de modo que todos los jugadores puedan verla. De haber más cartas sobre la mesa, la nueva carta deberá cubrirlas de manera que solo se vea la última carta revelada. Acto seguido deberá realizar todos los PASOS que hayan salido hasta el momento en el orden correcto, o, en el caso de que haya salido una carta de evaluación, seguir las instrucciones de esta.

Your spaceship, the Daedalus, has crashed on the planet Xorakus! You must work together to explore this alien world, find resources, repair your ship, and escape with your lives.

The crew has many characters to choose from, each with their own special abilities and a unique set of base skills. You can customize your character by gaining cards from their advancement deck.

Explore or scout new territory by placing hexagon tiles from a variety of terrain categories. Then reveal the corresponding Encounter cards (Items, Enemies, Events, etc.) that could either help or hinder your efforts.
 Once each round, activate native Xorakians and other enemies with a card from the Movement deck. Track the Xorakian Body Count with the Status Display Dial, but be careful; as the kills begin to mount your ability to communicate with them will slip away.

You’ll have to stay on mission and gather resources like fuel, electronics, and machine parts, which are necessary to fix the damaged systems of your spaceship.

Once everything has been repaired the players must make it back onboard and blast off to win the game of Xorakus!

—description from the designer

The fifth anniversary of Claim will be celebrated with a special limited Claim Anniversary Edition. In this edition the factions that where released in Claim and Claim 2 are re-illustrated by five different illustrators each with their own style. Next to these factions, the Anniversary Edition contains seven new factions; Automatons, Folk Singers, Griffins, Farmers, Racoons, Royals, Vikings. Also four new scenario cards (S18 - S21) are added to the package.

—description from the publisher
